DOC.HEAD: Pentagon Identifies One Serviceman Killed in Panama
DOC.TEXT: The Pentagon today identified one of the 11 U.S. servicemen killed in the invasion of Panama as Marine Cpl. Garreth C. Isaak, a native of Greenville, S.C. Isaak, 22, entered the Marine Corps on May 29, 1985, the Pentagon said. Fifty-nine U.S. servicemen were wounded, one was missing, and an unidentified female civilian dependent was reported killed in the invasion. Pentagon officials said they would release the identities of the other casualties after their next-of-kin had been notified.
